result.execSummary:
The defendant William M. Fude was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William M. Fude is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William M. Fude was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Perform 50 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable orgainization.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  Huber allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION. TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Agent has discretion to release the deft upon completion of the Living Free Program.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, William M. Fude, appeared with Attorney Philip Edward Marry.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  Credit for 19 days if revoked.  As a condition court imposes and stays 2 months in the KCJ w/ huber and DE is ordered to complete 50 hours of community service.  Cash Bond on deposit to be applied.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, William M. Fude, appeared with Attorney Philip Edward Marry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Marry states DE has an appt. with him on Thursday to go over application for Behavioral Health Court and requests an adjournment.  FPT on 7/7/15 at 10:50 AM
Posted $500 on 5/30/15

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Phil Marry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Marry states DE is still attempting to get into Behavioral Court and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  FPT on 6/16/15 at 11:10 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Phil Marry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Marry states DE was denied drug court and requests an adjournment to see if DE is eligible for behavioral health court; no objection by the State.  FPT on 5/27/15 at 10:50 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Philip Marry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Marry states he received an email from the drug court prosecutor and they will be doing an assessment within the next 2 weeks and requests an adjournment.  Status Conf. on 5/5/15 at 10:20 AM.
Per confirmation with Atty Marry's Office the FPT has been moved to 4/16 at 10:30 AM and Atty Marry to provide notice to his client.
Per call received from Atty Marry's office he will no longer be available on 3/26/15 due to a death in the family/funeral.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney James Allen specially for Attorney Phillip Marry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Allen requests an adjournment pendings DE's revocation hearing which is scheduled for 3/16/15; no objection by the State.  FPT on 3/26/15 at 2:15 PM.

Atty Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Philip Marry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Marry requests an adjournment as they are waiting on notice for his sentencing after revocation and DE wants to re-apply for drug court; no objection by the State.  Status Conf. on 3/4/15 at 9:40 AM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
